page.title: 11A typical local farm (Cont.)
page.content: Friday 3lst May.l985 6.30 Started work,Pat did the milking while Brian rues up 10 acres of grass which had been cut the previous day,finished at 8am,had breakfast ,8.30am greased and fuelled silage machinery ,9.00am started to pick up the grass with the forage waggon Brian's Dad arrived to buck rake the grass into the pit stopped at llam for cup of coffee, continued until lpm.After lunch continued picking up grass until 6pm.Pat did milking from 4-6pm at 6pm had tea.6.30 Dad went home so picked up more grass and buck raked by myself until Richard arrived at 8.00pm. Continued until the field complete at ll.30pm.-100 tonnes of silage made. Pat and Brian generally work together until lunch time and again from 4.30.The children help after school and at weekends.
